newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU releases notice on Anglo's Lonrho stake.
newsitem.headline: EU releases notice on Anglo's Lonrho stake.

text.p: The European Commission said in a notice on Wednesday it was notified on November 14 of Anglo American Corp's control of Britain's Lonrho.
The Commission has a month from that date to decide whether to clear the operation or start a four-month in-depth inquiry.

The EU's competition watchdog has made little secret that Anglo American, the South African mining giant, will face a hard task to have its 28-percent stake in Lonrho cleared under the European Union's merger rules.

In April, the EU blocked the merger of Lonrho's and Gencor's platinum interests, a rare step which only occurs when a corporate alliance seriously harms or threatens fair competition in the 15-nation bloc.
European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert warned Anglo at the time against taking control of Lonrho.
The notice will be published in the EU's Official Journal shortly, formally inviting interested parties to give their views on the case. -- Brussels newsroom 322 2876841
